nodes.long_description:
# VR Lawn Bowls – Step Onto the Green

Experience the sport of **lawn bowls** like never before in immersive **virtual reality**! Perfect your delivery, read the green, and challenge yourself across multiple game modes and skill levels.

# Smarter AI, Bigger Challenges

Take on **five levels of AI difficulty**—from beginner to pro—each offering unique strategies and shot precision. Whether you’re learning or looking for a serious test, there’s always a challenge waiting.

# Game Modes for Every Style

Play solo or team up in:
- **Singles** – One-on-one duels  
- **Pairs** – Tactical two-player matches  
- **Triples** – Team play with three  
- **Fours** – Full four-player strategy  

# Built for Meta Quest

With intuitive VR controls, realistic physics, and detailed greens, you’ll feel like you're right on the green. Just grab your controllers and bowl.

# Features

- 5 AI difficulty levels (Beginner to Pro)  
- Singles, Pairs, Triples, and Fours modes  
- Realistic throwing mechanics  
- Immersive audio and environments  
- Designed for Meta Quest headsets

Are you ready to become a VR bowls champion?
nodes.short_description: Step onto the green and experience the ultimate VR lawn bowls challenge! Compete in singles, pairs, triples, or fours against lifelike AI opponents across five skill levels—from beginner to pro. Precision, strategy, and immersive gameplay await. Are you ready to bowl like a champion?

nodes.long_description:
# VR Lawn Bowls – Step Onto the Green

Experience the sport of **lawn bowls** like never before in immersive **virtual reality**! Perfect your delivery, read the green, and challenge yourself across multiple game modes and skill levels.

---

# Smarter AI, Bigger Challenges

Take on **five levels of AI difficulty**—from beginner to pro—each offering unique strategies and shot precision. Whether you’re learning or looking for a serious test, there’s always a challenge waiting.

---

# Game Modes for Every Style

Play solo or team up in:
- **Singles** – One-on-one duels  
- **Pairs** – Tactical two-player matches  
- **Triples** – Team play with three  
- **Fours** – Full four-player strategy  

---

# Built for Meta Quest

With intuitive VR controls, realistic physics, and detailed greens, you’ll feel like you're right on the green. Just grab your controllers and bowl.

---

# Features

- 5 AI difficulty levels (Beginner to Pro)  
- Singles, Pairs, Triples, and Fours modes  
- Realistic throwing mechanics  
- Immersive audio and environments  
- Designed for Meta Quest headsets

---

Are you ready to become a VR bowls champion?
nodes.short_description: Step onto the green and experience the ultimate VR lawn bowls challenge! Compete in singles, pairs, triples, or fours against lifelike AI opponents across five skill levels—from beginner to pro. Precision, strategy, and immersive gameplay await. Are you ready to bowl like a champion?

nodes.change_log:
v0.9.0 (17 October)
- Added tutorial
- New game settings are remembered between game sessions
- Fixed bug where active bowls from loaded games were grabbable
- Fixed bug with resetting the players position when not in a game

v0.8.0 (22 September)
- Added a weather system to simulate wind, rain and sun. The longer and heavier the rain falls, the slower the green will be
- The volume of the bowl and jack rolling and colliding sounds are now based on their speed
- Added 4 plain colour bowl patterns
- Menus will no longer be moved to always be in front of you
- The jack target is now optional
- User position can now be reset by pulling both triggers
- The result of an end is now displayed once completed
- Fixed bug with saving game with dead bowls
- Fixed bug where bowling arm usage wasn't being saved
- Fixed bug with aim guide not being placed on bank
- NOTE: AI bowls aren't affected by wind or rain yet because recalculating their equations takes a really long time

v0.7.0 (29 August)
- Added a new game mode called Free Mode. It removes the rink boundary and allows you to place the mat anywhere on the green and deliver the jack any distance in any direction

v0.6.0 (15 August)
- Added bowling arms
- Jack now gets reset if it stops less than 3m from mat
- If jack is released more than 2m in front of mat, it's now marked as incorrectly delivered
- You can vote once per day on which features you would like added next
- Fixed bug with bowl bias for left handers if they are starting the end
- Fixed bugs with loading game where jack hasn't been delivered
- Fixed bug where you could grab the jack when it was the AIs turn to throw it

v0.5.0 (7 August)
- Recalculated Pro AI to be even more accurate
- The length of the rink can now be changed
- You can now select which rink you want to play on
- The aim guide now adjusts to bias width
- Fixed bug with bowls which didn't stop moving if hit when loaded from a save game

v0.4.1 (22 July)
- Added a pattern selector with 6 options for your bowls
- Added feedback form
- Fixed bugs with data collection. Given the delete data button and usage data toggles weren't working, all data has been deleted from the database

v0.4.0 (21 July)
- Added team colours to bowl rings
- After the bowl finishes moving, a number is added above every live bowl indicating it's rank
- The current head situation is now shown in the wrist display
- Each player can now select how wide the bias of their bowls is from "Straight" to "Unreasonably Wide"
- Added usage data collection and error reporting

v0.3.0 (7 July)
- Added main menu with user profiles
- Added settings menu with ground level reset, background sound volume control and toggles for the rink boundary, movement vignette and smooth turning
- Game progress is saved locally after every bowl so you can resume games at a later time
- Fixed bug with the gyroscopic presession for left handed players
- Added aim guide to help with getting the right green
